Description: A painted limestone funerary stela carved in the shape of a niche with two columns supporting an arch and shell niche-head. The two line Coptic inscription commemorates a man named Besa. Under the inscription, a square projection depicts an encircled cross. The stela is re-carved from a Ptolemaic period temple relief with fragmentary hieroglyphic text and depicts the falcon god Horus ('He of Behdet, lord of the sky').
Bibliographic references: Fluck et al. 2015 / Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs (p.238)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015-2016, Oct 29-Feb 7, London, BM, G35, Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs.
